Objects.Name: wings
Objects.Description: A pair of wings is sitting here.

Objects.Name: fire ball fireball
Objects.Description: A fireball lies here burning.

Objects.Name: ruby red slippers
Objects.Description: A pair of ruby slippers lies here.

Objects.Name: emails listing
Objects.ShortDescription: an email listing of the gods
Objects.Description: The email listing of the gods is pinned against the wall.
Objects.ExtraDescription: HELP CONTACT

Objects.Name: foraged berries
Objects.Description: A few discolored berries that someone foraged.
Objects.ExtraDescription: These blue, red, and even green berries look edible.  Though you do wonderabout all those stories of poisonous berries out in the woods.  These don'tsmell bitter, so they must be fine.

Objects.Name: greens forage
Objects.Description: Someone has foraged some greens to eat, but just left them here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: An assortment of leaves and grasses that look rather bland.  But if you hadto a person could survive off this meager cuisine.  After all, how do you thinkall these animals live out here.

Objects.Name: foraged roots
Objects.Description: A pile of roots that someone collected for dinner.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Tubular roots of varying sizes and colors.  They look very edible.  Some ofthem are known to even taste good!  You recognize on of a purplish hue that isextremely sweet and is actually considered a delicacy in some parts.

Objects.Name: foraged bark
Objects.Description: A pile of bark is stacked neatly in front of you.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Now this is gross!  It must be desperate times when you have to turn toeating tree bark.  This stuff is still green luckily so it has some moisture toit.  But you really aren't going to eat this are you?

Objects.Name: foraged nuts
Objects.Description: Half a dozen nuts are lined up perfectly on the ground.
Objects.ExtraDescription: A variety of nuts that are very hard to come by.  Various animals hoardthese in their lairs, so if you are lucky enough to come across some then youcan just go nutty!

Objects.Name: waybread bread
Objects.Description: Some waybread has been put here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: The waybread is the traditional feed of elves when travelling, they call itlembas.  It is said to refresh the weary traveler greatly.

Objects.Name: water spring water
Objects.Description: Fresh water is bubbling up from a spring.

Objects.Name: staff sanctum
Objects.Description: The Staff of Sanctum stands here waiting to be taken up by those who are worthy.

Objects.Name: Ferret's black book
Objects.Description: A little black book is sitting here calling your name.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Upon these pages are players that have upset Ferret and will not receive help!DemigodSaintAngelPhoenixAlexander&w(Maybe you!)&y

Objects.Name: pile stool steaming
Objects.Description: A steaming pile of stool has recently been deposited here.

Objects.Name: quest_token_zone_1 token
Objects.Description: A quest token needs to be returned to the questmaster.
Objects.ExtraDescription: It is a plain gold coin with the symbol of Sanctus engraved on both sides.This token should be taken back to the questmaster to receive a reward.

Objects.Name: quest timer
Objects.Description: A small quest timer is ticking away.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This small device looks like an antique gold pocket watch.  One small handcounts down the 10 minutes a questor has to complete their quest.

Objects.Name: quest mobile head
Objects.ShortDescription: the head of the quest mob
Objects.Description: The head of a quest mob needs to be taken back to the questmaster.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This quest item is proof that you have hunted down and killed the quest mob.It needs to be returned to the questmaster within 10 minutes.

Objects.Name: portal gate gateway
Objects.Description: A shimmering portal hovers here forming a gateway to another place and time.

Objects.Name: sword quest War's Blood
Objects.Description: The sword of kings awaits a hero to wield it.
Objects.ExtraFlags: Glow, Humming, NoDonate, Magic, Bless, MagicUser, Cleric, Thief, NoSell
Objects.ExtraDescription: The blade of this beautiful weapon is inlaid with tiny wavelets.  The guardextends far out from the basket hilt, guarding the wielder from all attacks.Engraved across the blade are these words.  "Seek not death.  Seek not triumph.Seek wisdom, honor, and truth.  For I wield the spirit of my wielder, and bloodof heroes never dies."  These words are written in golden runes across thepolished steel of the blade.  War's blood is given only to those warriors meantfor greatness.  Remember, the sword wields the spirit of its master.

Objects.Name: Shadow Stealer dagger quest
Objects.Description: A piece of deepest midnight calls to you here.
Objects.ExtraFlags: Humming, NoDonate, Magic, MagicUser, Cleric, Warrior, NoSell
Objects.ExtraDescription: This long, thin dagger is made of the blackest metal you have ever seen.  Itseems to devour all the light in its vicinity, making it appear as if it were apart of the very night.  As you look at the blade and hilt, you can make out aninscription which travels from the point of the weapon to its ornately engravedpommel.  "Whosoever would let blood for love, whosoever would make war upondeath, whosoever would give their life to love, make war with my darkness."Wield this fabled blade of lost love, and become one with the shadows.

Objects.Name: staff spellfire quest
Objects.Description: A burning staff of magical power floats in the air under its own power.
Objects.ExtraFlags: Glow, Humming, NoDonate, Invisible, Magic, Bless, Cleric, Thief, Warrior, NoSell
Objects.ExtraDescription: Wrought of the pure weave, bound by mortal spells, wielded by only thehighest of sorcerers, this staff is a burning rod of pure magic.  The whiteflame that gives it substance flickers and flares as you watch, threatening tobreak its magical wards and devour its surroundings.  As you hold this weapon,these words are burned into your mind.  "From the flash to the flame, my lightshall guide the wizardry with wisdom.  From the beginning to the end, therewill I be; to weave the one force eternal."

Objects.Name: mace quest divine blessing
Objects.Description: A gift from the gods is here seeking a worthy mortal.
Objects.ExtraFlags: Glow, Humming, NoDonate, Magic, Bless, MagicUser, Thief, Warrior, NoSell
Objects.ExtraDescription: This heavy iron mace hums with suppressed power.  Its surface is engravedwith thousands of tiny runes of all the deities that have ever been and everwill be.  Written across the flanges of the head are these words, "Let faith bethe beginning.  Let the body be its instrument.  Let divinity flow through thewielder of my force.  Believe and be blessed."

Objects.Name: silver bow quest
Objects.ShortDescription: the silver bow of the light
Objects.Description: A mighty force for good seeks a champion of the light.
Objects.ExtraFlags: Glow, Humming, NoDonate, Magic, Bless, AntiEvil, AntiNeutral, NoSell
Objects.ExtraDescription: Resplendent as the sun, this bow of pure silver seems to exude purity andgoodness.  The bow itself is a shaft of pure silver, inscribed with sunburstsand lightning bolts.  Its string is a thread of purest white light that shimmersas you look at it.  No arrow is needed for this mighty weapon.  Its wielder neednever carry a quiver.  If you listen closely, you can hear the weapon hummingwith its own energy.  If you listen long enough you might hear these words inits song.  "Let light banish darkness.  Let Hope banish fear.  I am the heraldof the end.  Where I strike, only light remains."

Objects.Name: spear balance quest
Objects.Description: The greatest symbol of balance seeks the hearts of evil and good alike.
Objects.ExtraFlags: Glow, Humming, NoDonate, Magic, AntiGood, AntiEvil, NoSell
Objects.ExtraDescription: The Lance of heroes.  The spear of mortal man.  The shaft of this legendarypike is carved from the wood of the tree of life.  Though separated from thetree that gave it life, the wood is a living, thinking entity.  Full 6 feet inlength, the shaft's wood is smooth and unbroken by any scratch or mark.  Thehead of the spear is a huge dragon's fang, rumored to be from the mouth of thegod Balm himself.  Etched in runes across the head of the spear are these words."Find gray where only black and white were before.  Seek truth where others seekgood and evil.  Bring justice through the scales of balance.  Then may you wieldthe truth that is my gift."

Objects.Name: axe quest doomslaying
Objects.Description: The axe meant to end all that is good in the realms floats here seeking a head to remove.
Objects.ExtraFlags: Humming, NoDonate, Magic, AntiGood, AntiNeutral, NoSell
Objects.ExtraDescription: Darkest midnight, purest evil, death embodied.  This weapon is the end of allthat is good.  Made only of shadows and the taint that is the most obscenecorruption, the head of this axe is jagged and spiked.  The blade is balanced bya wicked spike giving this ancient weapon the look of a warped headsman's axe.No light seems to reach it, no living thing seeks its touch.  Tendrils of sicklysmoke rise from the blade tainting your thoughts and the very air around you.It calls you, it draws you.  "Wield me, worship me, watch me take the blood ofthe pure.  Become one with my taint.  Feel the foulness fermenting your soul.Accept evil, accept the shadow.  Wield me and become death.  Become immortal."

Objects.Name: cap quickling quest
Objects.Description: A small cap of the faerie folk seeks the grasp of a true quickling.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This small green cap is made of a fine velvet lined with silk.  Its materialseems to conform to your touch, as if trying to accommodate itself to yourgrasp.  Its only distinctive feature is a emerald studded silver stickpinjutting jauntily out of the front of the cap.  A peace of silk ribbon forms aband around the inside of the brim.  These words have been embroidered into thecap's material.  "The world is a wonder.  A wonder to wander.  To wander thewonderful world.  That is the life of a sprite.  Come, my brothers, for much islost that we may find.  Come, my sisters, for many are lost that we may love.Happiness is a laugh away.  Live and laugh and love; that is joy."

Objects.Name: armbands midnight sun land quest
Objects.ShortDescription: the armbands of the land of the midnight sun
Objects.Description: The symbol of trollish heroes awaits the next leader of the tribes.
Objects.ExtraDescription: These huge bands of red metal are scratched and marked from years of battleand blood.  Crude markings cover their surface, chronicling the history of thetrollish race in gory detail.  Marked in magical runes on the inside of eachband are these words.  "Breaking bones, bringing blood, battering battle, blessme brothers, My eyes see red, my claws drip scarlet, and my soul is crimsonedwith the blood of the hunt.  We will triumph, for there is no cure for death."

Objects.Name: star man quest
Objects.Description: The light of humanity guides you onward here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This beautiful gem was mined from the center of the mountain from which thestone of Sanctus's walls is constructed.  It pulses with the glow of true magic.Carved by the finest craftsman, enchanted by the most powerful wielders of themagical arts, this stone was made for the greatest of the human race.  Look intoits depths, and see all the souls of mortal man.  It has no peer, no equal, andhas yet to be classified by dwarven miners or gnomish scholars.  The human whoholds it holds the light of all humanity in their grasp.

Objects.Name: shield quest wyrmguard
Objects.Description: The protection of dragon-kind seeks the next hero of the wryms.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Torn from Balm's breast, this scale has been shaped into a shield ofunrivaled strength and beauty.  Its diamond shape expands and shapes itself toprotect any dragon who bears it, from the youngest of hatchlings, to the mostancient of wyrms.  The shield shimmers and wavers with all the colors of therainbow.  In its shimmering depths can be seen all the colors of every dragonthat has ever come to pass.  Magical runes circle the shield's rim.  "Come wind,come fire.  Come Thunder, come rain.  My bearer need never fear.  Come giants toduel.  My roar of triumph will be the last you ever hear."

Objects.Name: heartguard armor quest
Objects.Description: The pride of the dwarven race lies here unused.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This armor has been forged from the purest iron that can be found in mortalrealms.  Its surface has been polished time and time again till it gleams withdark perfection.  The finest dwarven smiths have placed all their knowledge inits making.  The most hallowed dwarven priests have gifted this armor with theirblessing.  It has no peer, no equal.  Inscribed on the armor's breastplate arethese words: "To march to the clang of the hammer.  To be cooled by thewhistling wind of the whirling axe.  Come foe, come fool; Break yourself on therock of the dwarf.  Eternal wealth awaits, and we will not be denied."

Objects.Name: scholar's guide jeweler's loop quest
Objects.Description: The Guide to all Gnomish knowledge hums here quietly.
Objects.ExtraDescription: You are looking at what could quite possibly be one of the most beautifulpeaces of artistry ever made.  This finely crafted jeweler's loop is suspendedfrom a chain of golden links.  The loop itself is a perfectly made combinationof ground glass, perfectly crafted silver, and precision gnomish workmanship.It is so simple as to be elegant.  A tiny plaque hangs from the chain thatsuspends the loop.  "To you who would sacrifice for life, join me.  To you whowould become a slave to wonder, hold me.  To you who seek riches throughlearning, I am yours."

Objects.Name: boots strider quest
Objects.Description: The companions to the wanderlust sit here waiting for travel.
Objects.ExtraDescription: These fine boots have been made from the hides of monsters and beasts theworld over.  They are unadorned black suede leather, with a thick sole andsteel toe.  The stitching that holds them together is so fine as to beinvisible.  As you look at them, words enter your mind.  "Trip over mountain.Stride over sea.  Travel across desert.  Run between the forest trees.  Be bold,be brave.  Be unfettered.  Let us run the world over.  You and me."

Objects.Name: battleaxe dragonbane quest axe
Objects.Description: The bane of all wyrmkin seeks the heart of a dragon.
Objects.ExtraFlags: Glow, Humming, NoDonate, Magic, Bless, NoSell
Objects.ExtraDescription: There is no greater weapon in mortal hands.  This is an instrument of death.The two-headed axe was meant for the hands of a giant.  The shaft and hilt ofthis mighty blade are formed from a gray stone that can never be chipped orbroken.  The head of the weapon is formed from two massive pieces of obsidian,shaped like diamonds, side by side.  However this vicious object has but onepurpose.  Etched into the two heads of the axe are these words.  "Slash, slice,swerve and swipe.  Dodge, duck, down and up.  I draw the blood of the weak.Thunder marks my strike.  Lightning shines when I am drawn.  I am the storm toend all.  I am the dragonbane."

Objects.Name: cloak Elven court quest
Objects.ShortDescription: the cloak of the elven court
Objects.Description: A heavy cloak of brown and green is here for the next elven king.
Objects.ExtraDescription: A heavy, richly embroidered, cloak of green and brown.  Its color changes asyou move, blending in with the world around you.  A simple wooden clasp holds ittogether at the neck.  It would be like any other nobleman's traveling cloakwere it not for one thing.  Laced with thread so fine it almost isn't there, thesymbol of the Elven court is sewn over the breast of the cloak.  This is thegarment of the Elven court.  Its bearers are the pride of their race.  Only 6heroes have ever been worthy to wear such a mark of honor.

Objects.Name: Gloves kindred quest
Objects.Description: Some fine gloves sit hear itching to grab something.
Objects.ExtraDescription: A set of lithe leather riding gloves.  The leather is so thin as to almostnot be there.  The palm and fingertip of each glove are padded with a lining ofcloth to protect the wearer's hand against harm.  Looking at these tiny glovesyou wonder what keeps them from just tearing at the slightest pressure.

Objects.Name: gem sanctum
Objects.Description: One of the lost treasures of Sanctum is here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This is one of the treasures from the hoards of the city of Sanctum.

Objects.Name: staff curative
Objects.Description: A staff used by the healers of Sanctum is here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This beautiful staff is used by the healers of sanctum.

Objects.Name: runestone sanctum church
Objects.Description: A runestone of the church of Sanctum has been left here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This is one of the runestones used by the priests of Sanctum in their duties.

Objects.Name: Bell sanctum freedom
Objects.Description: The symbol of Sanctum's freedom waits to be returned to its city.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This is the bell that represents the freedom of the city of Sanctum.

Objects.Name: hammer Sanctum
Objects.Description: The hammer used to ring Sanctum's mighty bell is here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This is the hammer used to ring the bell of freedom in the church of Sanctum.

Objects.Name: Guards Eternal Flame quest
Objects.Description: The spirit of Wyvern Rulers seeks a new Guardian of the flames.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Guardians of history, heroes of legend, Ancients of elder years.  These arethe Guards worn by those chosen to rule all of Drake kind.  The material thatforms them glows and smokes like living flame.  However, it is cool to thetouch, forming an impenetrable barrier against all attacks.  These leggings seemto shimmer before your very eyes, fact or fiction, they look as though theycould vanish at any turn.  Looking deep into the fire that is their strength yousee these words in yellow and red flame.  "Drawn from the depths.  Deliveredfrom death.  Directed by Divinity.  I am the truth.  The light.  The guardian ofhope and the future.  Find comfort in my flames.  Find strength in my touch.For with me lies all that is to come."

Objects.Name: questpoint setter immortal device
Objects.Description: An immortal device to set questpoints.

Objects.Name: key gateguard
Objects.Description: The gateguards key was left here.

Objects.Name: magic eight ball eightball
Objects.Description: A mysterious looking magic eight ball holds the answer.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Simply "shake eightball" to have all of your questions answered.

Objects.Name: bed comfy
Objects.Description: A comfy bed is begging you to take a nap.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This bed is beckoning you to lie down and get some much needed sleep.Just "sleep bed"

Objects.Name: quarter coin
Objects.Description: A typical U.S. quarter that appears to be perfect for flipping.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This quarter is perfect for deciding those difficult boolean questions youmay have. Just "flip quarter"

Objects.Name: generic light
Objects.Description: A generic light is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Since this light is completely generic there are no distinctive featuresworth noticing.

Objects.Name: generic ring rfinger
Objects.Description: A generic ring is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Since this ring is completely generic there are no distinctive features worthnoticing.

Objects.Name: generic ring lfinger
Objects.Description: A generic ring is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Since this ring is completely generic there are no distinctive features worthnoticing.

Objects.Name: generic neck1 necklace
Objects.Description: A generic necklace is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Since this necklace is completely generic there are no distinctive featuresworth noticing.

Objects.Name: generic neck2 necklace
Objects.Description: A generic necklace is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Since this necklace is completely generic there are no distinctive featuresworth noticing.

Objects.Name: generic body armor
Objects.ShortDescription: a set of generic body armor
Objects.Description: A set of generic body armor is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Since this body armor is completely generic there are no distinctive featuresworth noticing.

Objects.Name: generic helm
Objects.Description: A generic helm is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Since this helm is completely generic there are no distinctive features worthnoticing.

Objects.Name: generic leggings
Objects.Description: A pair of generic leggings are lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Since this pair of leggings is completely generic there are no distinctivefeatures worth noticing.

Objects.Name: generic boots
Objects.Description: A pair of generic boots are lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Since the pair of boots are completely generic there are no distinctivefeatures worth noticing.

Objects.Name: generic gloves
Objects.Description: A pair of generic gloves are lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Since the pair of gloves are completely generic there are no distinctivefeatures worth noticing.

Objects.Name: generic sleeves
Objects.Description: A pair of generic sleeves are lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Since the pair of sleeves are completely generic there are no distinctivefeatures worth noticing.

Objects.Name: generic shield
Objects.Description: A generic shield is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Since the shield is completely generic there are no distinctive featuresworth noticing.

Objects.Name: generic cape
Objects.Description: A generic cape is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Since the cape is completely generic there are no distinctive features worthnoticing.

Objects.Name: generic belt
Objects.Description: A generic belt is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Since the belt is completely generic there are no distinctive features worthnoticing.

Objects.Name: generic wristguard
Objects.Description: A generic wristguard is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Since the wristguard is completely generic there are no distinctive featuresworth noticing.

Objects.Name: generic wristguard
Objects.Description: A generic wristguard is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Since the wristguard is completely generic there are no distinctive featuresworth noticing.

Objects.Name: generic weapon
Objects.Description: A generic weapon is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Since this weapon is completely generic there are no distinctive featuresworth noticing.

Objects.Name: generic staff
Objects.Description: A generic staff is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Since this staff is completely generic there are no distinctive featuresworth noticing.

Objects.Name: commissars key
Objects.Description: A large key painted red and hanging on a metal ring was left here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This old fashioned skeleton key has been painted a bright red and is allalone on an over-sized metal key ring.

Objects.Name: wooden signopened
Objects.Description: A simple wooden sign hanging from a shop to the North states, "OPEN."
Objects.ExtraDescription: The wooden sign says OPEN in big bright letters.

Objects.Name: wooden signclosed
Objects.Description: A simple wooden sign hanging from a shop to the North states, "CLOSED."
Objects.ExtraDescription: The wooden sign says CLOSED in big bright letters.

Objects.Name: chinese finger trap fingertrap cardboard tube
Objects.Description: A strange and colorful tube was left here. It is made from cardboard intricately woven together.
Objects.ExtraKeyword: chinese finger trap fingertrap cardboard tube
Objects.ExtraDescription: It consists of at least a dozen different colors of cardboard woven togetherinto a tube.  The holes on each end are just about the right size to stick afinger in.

Objects.Name: paintball gun red
Objects.Description: A red paintball gun was abandoned here.

Objects.Name: paintball gun blue
Objects.Description: A blue paintball gun was abandoned here.

Objects.Name: teleporter
Objects.Description: A strange device labeled "teleporter" was left here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This teleporter is used to transfer players between zones.  Accessible zonesare listed under HELP ZONES by being CAPITALIZED.  For example to teleport to:  74 Newbie GRAVEyard                   -- Jojen                       3- 5type: teleport grave   The teleporter may also be used to recall back to Midgaard at any time.Uncapitalized zones are linked through a capitalized zone.

Objects.Name: slip paper tapcode code
Objects.Description: A small slip of paper has something written on it.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Below is a tap code we use to communicate through the walls by tapping 2 numbers.TAPS| 1 | 2 |  3  | 4 | 5 |1   | A | B |C/K| D | E | The first designates the horizontal row and the 2nd2   | F | G |  H  | I | J | designates the vertical row. The letter W, for3   | L | M |  N  | O | P |  example, would be 5-2. The letter H would be 2-3.4   | Q | R |  S  | T | U | The letter "c" works double duty as a c or k.5   | V | W |  X  | Y | Z |

Objects.Name: drain shower hidden
Objects.Description: .a hidden object!
Objects.ExtraDescription: The metal drain is covered with years of hair and grime. Several screwsholding the drain in place seem to be missing.

Objects.Name: pick iron
Objects.Description: A small piece of metal wire has been sharpened into a pick.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This small piece of wire has been filed or sanded into a sharp point andresembles some time of lock picking device.

Objects.Name: shackles pair
Objects.Description: A pair of shackles have been left here open.
Objects.ExtraDescription: These iron shackles are heavy with a chain of about 20 links connecting thetwo ankle braces.

Objects.Name: throne chair bayonets
Objects.Description: A throne of sharp bayonets looks like the last place you would want to sit.
Objects.ExtraDescription: The chair is made completely out of bayonets with the sharpest points in themost inconvenient of spots.  A plaque on the bottom reads: "You can build athrone of bayonets, but you can't sit on it for long."

Objects.Name: idleout timer stayalive bracelet
Objects.Description: A bright orange plastic bracelet was left here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: The bracelet is made of a garish orange plastic with the letters STAYALIVEcarved into the outer band. It is rumored that this bracelet will keep peoplefrom going linkdead.

Objects.Name: iron shackles
Objects.Description: A pair of shackles are securely fastened around both of your ankles.
Objects.ExtraDescription: The shackles are locked closed about your ankles with the link chain loopedthrough a steel ring cemented into the floor.

Objects.Name: ice cream 99 flake
Objects.Description: An ice cream has been dropped here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: Known as the 99, it is an ice cream cornet with a stick of chocolate rammedin. First sold in 1922 at the ice cream shop at 99 the High Street, Portobello,Scotland.

Objects.Name: full english breakfast fatty food
Objects.Description: A full English Breakfast is being served here in all its fatty glory.
Objects.ExtraDescription: 'Heaven on a plate' or the quickest route to a heart attack. Eggs, bacon,sausages, baked beans, hashed browns, mushrooms, tomatoes, black pudding andfried bread. Available variants include the so-called Jewish Breakfast, servedwith turkey ham and beef sausages, or the vegetarian breakfast, served withquorn sausages.

Objects.Name: tea mug cup nice tea
Objects.Description: A nice mug of tea has been left here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: A nice mug of fair trade tea, all you need now is a nice piece of cake.From its home in China to the break times of Britain, Tea is the drink of AsianEmperors and European Monarchs, as well as sweatshop workers in the east and ITworkers in the west.

Objects.Name: board
Objects.Description: The warriors board has been posted here to allow fellow fighters to communicate.

Objects.Name: clerics board
Objects.Description: A bulletin board for clerics to keep in touch with each other.

Objects.Name: thieves board
Objects.Description: A board for thieves to relate their current plots and schemes is hidden here.

Objects.Name: mages board
Objects.Description: A board for mages to post to others in their class is glowing brightly here.

Objects.Name: coffee cup mug coffee
Objects.Description: A coffee cup has been left here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: A coffee cup, it is marked with the letters 'TBA'. Coffee originated fromthe Kaffa region in Ethiopia, and while long drunk in the Arab world, it didnot enter Europe until the British East India Company began to import theproduct in the 16th Century. The first coffee house in Europe was founded inOxford during 1650, and by 1670 there was already a coffee house in theMassachusetts Bay Colony.

Objects.Name: board sign notice writing
Objects.Description: @gA small @Gsign@g hangs on the wall.@n
Objects.ExtraDescription: Please keep discussions within the room as much as possible, so that peoplecan build with clear screens.

Objects.Name: scythe death
Objects.Description: The Scythe of Death rests heavily on the ground.
Objects.ExtraDescription: It is a very heavy scythe.  The gray handle is made from hard wood and thelong iron blade is completely smooth from countless years of use.  It feels coldto the touch.
